Machine double precision: 2.220446049250313e-16

Test case:
a = 1, b = 1, c = 10^-n for n = 1, 2, 3, ...

---------------------------------------------------------------------

n = 1

PARI/GP (x1, x2) = -0.1127016653792583114820734600,
-0.8872983346207416885179265400

x1, x2 = -0.1127016653792583, -0.8872983346207417
Error: 1.1482073460000297595 E-17, -1.1482073459992408986 E-17

x1', x2' = -0.11270166537925831, -0.8872983346207418
Error: 1.4820734600005295318 E-18, -1.1148207345999955595 E-16

All errors are near or below the machine precision.

---------------------------------------------------------------------

n = 5

PARI/GP (x1, x2) = -1.000010000200005000140004200 E-5,
-0.9999899998999979999499986000

x1, x2 = -1.0000100002016676e-05, -0.9999899998999979
Error: -1.6625998599957999858 E-17, 9.994999859999630154 E-17

x1', x2' = -1.000010000200005e-05, -0.9999899998983355
Error: 1.4000420001123169328 E-24, 1.6624999499985999986 E-12

The error in x1' here is very small compared to the machine
precision but the error in x2' is quite large.

---------------------------------------------------------------------

n = 10

PARI/GP (x1, x2) = -1.000000000100000000020000000 E-10
-0.9999999998999999999900000000

x1, x2 = -1.000000082740371e-10, -0.9999999999
Error: -8.264037099998000000000057687 E-18, -1.000000000 E-20

x1', x2' = -1.0000000001000001e-10, -0.9999999172596359
Error: -9.997999999999874346 E-27, 8.264036409999000000000445269 E-8

The error in x2' is now extremely high compared to the machine
precision
